title: AAAS: Science Advances: Table of Contents
description: Science Advances: Open access, multidisciplinary science journal.

items.title: Oxide semiconductor in a neuromorphic chromaticity communication loop for extreme environment exploration | Science Advances
items.description: A neuromorphic chromaticity communication loop demonstrates potential for extreme environment exploration.

items.title: Astrocytes-derived LCN2 triggers EV-A71–induced muscle soreness via accumulating lactate | Science Advances
items.description: HMGB1 promotes LCN2 secretion from brain, leading to lactate accumulation in muscle, which causes EV-A71-induced muscle soreness.

items.title: Engineered high endurance in WO3-based resistive switching devices via a guided filament approach | Science Advances
items.description: A materials design greatly improves the endurance of WO3 memory devices, advancing future computing technologies.

items.title: Study of self-assembly behavior and ionic conductivity of conjugated liquid crystals with T-shaped facial-polyphilic structure | Science Advances
items.description: Polyphilic LCs with varying structures show potential application as ionic conducting materials.

items.title: Helical coassembly enables full-color efficient circularly polarized light emission from carbon dots with high dissymmetry factors | Science Advances
items.description: Full-color and efficient CPL from nontoxic carbon dots enables flexible luminous patterns and advanced anticounterfeiting.

items.title: Unidirectional molecular rotary motor with remotely switchable rotation direction | Science Advances
items.description: A redesigned molecular motor can be switched with an electric field to change the rotation direction.

items.title: Should we think of observationally constrained multidecade climate projections as predictions? | Science Advances
items.description: Well-constrained simulations of future warming can be thought of as skillful predictions rather than just projections.

items.title: Tunable chiral magneto-transport through band structure engineering in magnetic topological insulators Mn(Bi1−xSbx)2Te4 | Science Advances
items.description: Engineering Berry curvature and spin texture via band structure design opens an avenue for chiral spintronic applications.

items.title: Celluloepidemiology—A paradigm for quantifying infectious disease dynamics on a population level | Science Advances
items.description: Celluloepidemiology offers cell-driven insights into human immunity against pathogens on a population level.

items.title: Skillful multiyear prediction of flood frequency along the US Northeast Coast using a high-resolution modeling system | Science Advances
items.description: Flood frequency along the US Northeast Coast is predictable 3 years in advance due to AMOC variations.
